docs.snippet: DRIFTING continues to be the main feature in the aspect of business as the turn of the year draws nigh. There has  been shown a quickening in certain lines accompanied by an increase in production, but this is rather the exception than the rule.
docs.lead_paragraph: DRIFTING continues to be the main feature in the aspect of business as the turn of the year draws nigh. There has been shown a quickening in certain lines accompanied by an increase in production, but this is rather the exception than the rule.

docs.snippet: A BIG idea from a little country--the electric "time ball." Every night precisely at 8, the electric lights in Montevideo, Uruguay, are dimmed slightly, once, for  about a second, just enough to attract attention. Whereupon people set their watches...
docs.lead_paragraph: A BIG idea from a little country--the electric "time ball." Every night precisely at 8, the electric lights in Montevideo, Uruguay, are dimmed slightly, once, for about a second, just enough to attract attention. Whereupon people set their watches and clocks.
docs.abstract: sp an on electric time ball

headline.main: ELECTRIC "TIME BALL"; South American System of Adjusting Watches Suggested for This Country

docs.snippet: The calling of a special session of the Legislature to enact a law prohibiting the use of State and national party emblems in municipal elections and requiring that candidates for municipal offices must be voted for on a separate ballot under...
docs.lead_paragraph: The calling of a special session of the Legislature to enact a law prohibiting the use of State and national party emblems in municipal elections and requiring that candidates for municipal offices must be voted for on a separate ballot under municipal party emblems was suggested yesterday by General Edward C. O'Brien, former Minister to Uruguay, a Republican.
docs.abstract: Gen O'Brien suggests calling session of N Y S Legislature to enact law prohibiting use of State and natl party emblems in municipial elections

headline.main: SEEKS TO RESTRICT PARTY EMBLEM USE; Gen. E.C. O'Brien Wants Law Compelling Separate Ballots for City Offices.
